name: Places in Singapore
description: Contain prompts that test model's udnerstanding places in Singapore, in True/False format

examples.input: Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The station code for the Joo Koon station on the East West MRT Line is EW29
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Woodlands is a place in the South of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Singapore has a Chestnut Nature Park that is a local nature preserve
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Serayana Island is part of the Southern Islands of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Brani Island is used by the Singapore Coast Guard and sits between Malaysia and Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Ang Mo Kio is a heartland town in Singapore north of the town of Toa Payoh
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Singapore Changi Airport has 5 terminals that are operational as at December 2023
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Raffles Lighthouse is part of Singapore, and is based on the mainland in the West of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Pulau Saigon still exists as part of Singapore today and is located along the Singapore River
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Sultan Shoal lighthouse is located on a small island off Singapore's western coast
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Jurong Island is not connected to mainland Singapore by a land bridge, and can only be reached by ferry service
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve is located in Johor, Malaysia
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Marina Reservoir was formed in 2008 when a dam was constructed across the mouth of Marina Bay
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Katong is one of the oldest villages in Singapore. Located at the southwest of the island, it boasts one of the best collection of local restaurants.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Pickering Street is named after the first Protector of Chinese of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Fort Canning Service Reservoir is an open air service reservoir at the top of Fort Canning Hill
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Stamford Canal is a covered canal that cuts across Raffles City and Citylink Mall in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Downtown MRT Line in Singapore connects Bukit Panjang in the northwest to Expo in the east of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Circle Line in Singapore is named after the trains, which have a circular design
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The former City Hall of Singapore, completed in 1929, is now part of the National Gallery of Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Fort Serapong was built in the early 1880s by the British in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: In Singapore, the distance between Ang Mo Kio and Hougang is farther than the distance between Ang Mo Kio and Changi
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Ramakrishna Mission Singapore is located near to Bartley Road in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Lazarus Island is the southern-most island in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Sentosa Island used to be known as Pulau Blakang Mati until 1969 when it was renamed
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The most direct route of travel under normal circumstances between Orchard MRT and City Hall MRT would see you pass by Somerset MRT
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Singapore's Windsor Nature Park sits between Lower Pierce Reservoir and MacRitchie Reservoir
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: As the crow flies, the distance from Thomson Nature Park to Seletar Island is more than 10 kilometers
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Pulau Ubin is connected to Singapore via a land bridge that crosses the channel between the island and mainland Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The most expedient route by car between Jurong and Changi is typically via the Pan Island Expressway
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The names of Paya Lebar and Toa Payoh towns in Singapore both stem from the name "Big Swamp"
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Changi Airport is located in the north of Singapore, close to Malaysia, and is the subject of frequent disputes between two countries about noise
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Singapore expressways are commonly abbreviated, with CTE, KPE, PIE, GGE, and BKE among them.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Dempsey Hill in Singapore is located close to the Singapore Botanical Gardens
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Roundabouts are a rare feature on Singapore's roadways. There are fewer than 10 roundabouts in Singapore.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is a hotel located at Marina Bay in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Victoria Concert Hall is located in Singapore's Civic District
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The original gates of the "New World Amusement Park" in Singapore is retained at the site of City Square Mall
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The closest MRT station to the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple in Singapore's Chinatown is Chinatown MRT Station
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Orchard Road is known as Singapore's main shopping belt district
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The highest peak in Singapore is Bukit Timah, which stands at more than 200 metres above sea level
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Tan Tock Seng Hospital is one of the major hospitals and trauma centres in Singapore
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The site of the former Hotel New World, which collapsed in 1986, is located near Farrer Park MRT Station
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Hougang, Tampines, Sengkang and Jurong West are among the largest towns in Singapore by land surface area.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Clemenceau Avenue in Singapore is named after Georges Clemenceau, who was a former Premier of France
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Rochor River, Whampoa River, and Kallang River are tributaries to the Singapore River
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: There are more than 20 hospitals in Singapore, including all private, public and community hospitals.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Bukit Batok, Ang Mo Kio, and Bedok are examples of heartland towns in Singapore that comprise mainly of residential developments.
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: Disneyland Singapore is located on Sentosa Island and is slated to open in 2026
Answer in TRUE or FALSE: The Amoy Street Food Centre is located around the Chinatown District in Singapore
